page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This 4km by 3km block consists mostly of farmland with the Hemel Hempstead new town area of Chaulden and the old village of Bourne End as residential area.There has been no very recent development because the non-residential area is Greenbelt.Most of Chaulden was built in the early 1950s,as Hemel Hempstead was designated a new town in 1949. Crossing the block are major transport routes:the Grand Union Canal,the A41 road which runs from Birmingham to London and the Glasgow to Euston railway line. There are a great variety of schools in the block,state and feepaying, infant and junior and a special school.
